thread.title: REPORT: Vikings Give Brian Robison A One-Year Contract Extension | Vikings Blog | KFAN FM 100.3
thread.title_full: REPORT: Vikings Give Brian Robison A One-Year Contract Extension | Vikings Blog | KFAN FM 100.3

title: REPORT: Vikings Give Brian Robison A One-Year Contract Extension | Vikings Blog | KFAN FM 100.3
text:
Digital Content Manager | KFAN.com 
The Minnesota Vikings have reportedly extended veteran defensive end Brian Robison through the 2018 season. 
According to NFL Insider Field Yates, Robison took a $1.4 million pay cut for the 2017 season to extend his contract an additional year. Source: Vikings DE Brian Robison has signed a 1-year extension through 2018. Now due a base value of $7.5M over 2 years, $5.15M guaranteed. â€” Field Yates (@FieldYates) March 24, 2017 
Robison was set to make up to $5.6 million in 2017 and had a base salary of $5.3 million; Robison will now make $3.9 million next year and, while his $100,000 workout bonus is still intact, his $200,000 in per-game roster bonuses for 2017 have been removed. 
Robison is coming off a 2016 campaign in which the 33-year old racked up 28 combined tackles, 7.5 sacks, one pass defensed and three forced fumbles. Check out Vikings.com for more information and Minnesota Vikings coverage throughout the year! Contact
